page.title: 08Features of the Church
page.content: The church has many interesting features, the most unusual is the thirteenth century bell turret which has twin pointed bell chambers flanked by tiny pinnacles. Another interesting feature is the canopied piscina in the chancel. Another piscina was discovered in the South trancept when the old pews were taken out. In it is standing a curious stone basin with a hole in the bottom. One of the oldest features in the church is the Norman doorway on the North side which is blocked up, but which would have been in use at the time of William the Conqueror's Doomsday Survey. A later King of England who left his mark in the church is George II who had his court of arms placed above the entry to the choir to remind the congregation of their loyalty to their King.
